column4: the ubuntu website says that oldworld macs aren't supported at all by ubuntu - would it be possible to boot from the cd via bootx?
not supported as in "it may or may not work, but we can't fix it at this point"
if you can get it installed, it should work fine
er, sure it's looing for /include? that dir doesn't exist on any linux system.
I'd guess it's looking for /includes/ under the kernel source tree, but the kernel source dir variable is empty
should I really need the kernel source for building this module?  According tot he howto it should only need linux-headers-*
the file it wants, config.h exists, include/linux is simply in /usr not /
er,, no, the files in /usr/include/ are not what you need
Thanks, for some reason my kernel version is 2.6.8.1-3 but 2.6.8.1-5 headers are available
you'll need to upgrade your kernel then
*-3 headers are available too though and apt-get upgrade doesn't install anything
obviously, I was just clarifying, thanks =)
ok, but there's already a fluxbox.desktop in /usr/share/xsessions
